title: Welding Safety Essentials
description: Set up a safe workspace, understand protective gear, and prevent common accidents.
tldr: Welding is safe when you control heat, sparks, and ventilation. Start with PPE, clear your area, and check equipment before each session.

sections.title: Personal protective equipment
sections.body: Always wear a properly rated helmet, gloves, jacket, and boots. Your goal is to protect eyes, skin, and lungs from heat, light, and fumes.

sections.title: Workspace checklist
sections.body: Remove flammable materials, secure your cables, and confirm a fire extinguisher is within reach. Good airflow reduces fume exposure.

sections.title: Pre-weld inspection
sections.body: Check torch condition, gas connections, and ground clamps. A quick inspection prevents most beginner mistakes.

quiz.question: What is the first priority before striking an arc?
quiz.explanation: Protective equipment is always step one.

quiz.question: Why is ventilation important?
quiz.explanation: Ventilation protects your lungs from welding fumes.

quiz.question: What should be within reach?
quiz.explanation: Fire safety tools should always be close.
